channel.title: Promising box solver on the way
channel.description:
ok, my next post is something more usefull, a box solver, thats fundementally different from other box solvers. instead trying to find the shape, it finds the number of slopes on a shape. for example, this star ive drawn (ill post a pic at the end of the page) has returned these:
0x4 2x10 -2x9 -1.4x2 -0.1x6 -0.0666666666666667x6 -1000000x2 -0.733333333333333x7 -0.730769230769231x2 1.875x3 -0.75x3 0.666666666666667x7
there are 10 points where the slope is 2, 9 where the slope is - 2, 6 where it is .06666, 7 -.733333, and 7 where it is .666666
these results are already heavily filtered for junk, but ill be able to get it better, soon i hope, to groop similar results. however, if i were to only ask for slopes with 5 or more, it would have told me 5 slopes. a star has 5 slopes, and hence i know its a star. a triangle returns 3, and a square returns 2. a circle returns none. unfortunately, a square in perspective also returns 3, however its guarranteed that 2 of edges will have similar slope, so it will return roughly double what the other slopes do.
now, why i really posted this post. i NEEEEEEED some screenshots of a mysterious box to work on, as it seems that no matter how hard i try (and i dont get very often either) mr mysterious will never come to me, so if you get one, take a few pics and post them!!!!!!![br][size=1]Posted at: July 26, 2006, 07:58:16 AM[/size][hr]ahhhhh i posted in the wrong forum. plz move to scar scripts and help. ty

item.title: Promising box solver on the way
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

lol. its actually very simple. and if i finished off my corner finder for the whole box, i would probally be able to do it in less that 200 lines of code. its a completely different idea that looks like it will provide promising results. it doesnt even have to wait for the box to line up perfectly so that a face is fully facing you, which is a bit of an added bonus speed wise. the numbers would be slightly trickier, but hell shit happens. now what i really really want to do, when the box pops up on your screen, some variables will have to be stored in memory. if i can find the numbers on the box in the memory, and the shapes, ill be able to make a program with about 20 lines to beat the box. not in scar of course. i actually have already found these numbers with a box i just got, however its not that simple. there will be a function called drawbox somewhere, which stores the vars into the memory. then its a matter of finding where this function is, and determining how the java vm stores the variables.

Read full topic
item.source: Promising box solver on the way

item.title: Promising box solver on the way
item.dc:creator: @dark_sniper dark_sniper
item.description:
@dark_sniper wrote:

ok well to the best of my knowelage only dtms and bitmaps can solve this box…

because the box rotates at randoms speeds…

it rotates at random angles a which way it rotates…

so if your not using bitmaps your using dtms

Read full topic

item.title: Promising box solver on the way
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

o i have a much better way of doing it than using bitmaps which should provide 90% accuracy or so, more so with the shapes than with the numbers. im not gonna say it, cause if they ever come up with a way of evading rotating bit maps, ill be right back on its case.

Read full topic
item.source: Promising box solver on the way

item.title: Promising box solver on the way
item.dc:creator: @dark_sniper dark_sniper
item.description:
@dark_sniper wrote:

works most of the time… i dont think your going to figure this thing out with slopes…

i used to have a script that used to tell you exactly what shape or number your looking for in what shape or with what number :… but i got it deled…

if your planing on using bitmapdeformedrotation or whatever itll probably work with larger effort but it will lag like no other.

but the bitmaps dont need to be rotated all the way around.

just till it over laps its orginal shape…

like the circle doesent need to be rotated… saving you lag.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

@MadCow- When I first got a box I thought I could trade it to other people and tried to bank it. To my surprise I saw I now had 2! I kept doing that thinking I was going to be rich… to then realize that I only got paid for the last one :X.

@Dead- Sounds promising, I hope it works out well.

item.description:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:6, topic:6233”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=8486.msg90678#msg90678 date=1153916137]
i get alot of strange boxes… heres a tip, if u ureself actually get one, leave it for a while so u get some more then it will be easier to work on…

[/quote]
Just drop em ;)[/quote]

Rofl. Thats what I did when I first got a box. Then more and more kept coming and I was confused.

Good ol’ days.

Mad Cow

item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

davidude36:

DEAD i just got a box, ive print screened as many of them as i can and listed them as like “1-square,1-pentagon…” and so on, but i doubt i have all of them… i can send the file through msn (dodgy i know) or if u can point me to a place i can host it… yer… so anyways i will prob be finished filing all of the shapes and numbers tomorow… dunno weathre this will help you but i mean ive never seen anyone list all of them…

If they are in low size format (png, gif, jpeg etc…) add me in MSN messenger and send them to me, I can host them.
my MSN: secetti@hotmail.com
